column4: nick, there was nothing about a screen password in man passwd
Are you specifically referring to screen?  If so, there is an option for establishing password protected screen sessions using, 'acladd.'  "man screen" has tons of info... perhaps too much :-)
ok to rephrase, i want a way to share a screen with another user so that they can watch me perform tasks, without knowing their unix password
I use screen on my headless server but I never bother with password protecting the detached screens simply because I'm the only one that logs into the server.
rob: how can i connect to a detached screen of a diff user tho?
So is suppose that, 'screen -r <username>' should re-attach to the default screen initiated by that user.
I meant, "So I suppose..." but you get the picture  :-)
If the user has more than one screen detached, then I believe it will re-attach to the first one.  If you want a specific one, you'd need to specify the tty, I think.
i think its working... but the other user had to explicitly give me privs to do it, turning on multiuser mode or something
Hmm, well, like I said,  I haven't done much in the way of multi-user screen sessions, etc.
